properties.areaDesc: Southwest Chaves County; Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 7:51PM MST until February 5 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...ADDITIONAL SNOW EXPECTED FOR PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL, SOUTH
CENTRAL, AND SOUTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO...

.A storm system continues to slowly swing eastward across New
Mexico, pushing additional light to moderate snow over some east
central, south central, and southeastern parts of the state.
Light accumulations of an additional inch or less are expected
along and north of Interstate 40 with heavier accumulations to the
south tonight. Locations in Lincoln and Chaves counties will
likely observe an additional 1 to 4 inches overnight with locally
higher amounts in the Sacramento and Capitan mountains.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4
inches with locally higher amounts in the Sacramento and Capitan
mountains.

* WHERE...South Central Mountains, Southwest Chaves County and
Eastern Lincoln County.

* WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing
snow will reduce visibility below 1 mile.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY
